Reviews.Title: “bellisimmo otel :)”
Reviews.Author: Tanja M
Reviews.Content: Location close to Termini. This hotel is for my standard price. My doughter loved bombons from receptionman :) .. Hotel is small but is ok, rooms is ok.. Best regards!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: edewar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned on staying at hotel felice for 5 nights....we left after 1. The walk to the hotel from the train station was through a dodgy part of town, not at all tourist friendly. The hotel itself was located in a very unappealling suburb with no metro close by. We briefly left our room for a meal, but did not feel particularly safe walking in the dark, so headed back for an early night! Our room was dingy and dark with no natural light- fine if the light was brighter than a candle! The bathroom smelt like sewerage, the shower screen was off its hinge and the toilet bowl was not secured to the floor. Paper thin walls allowed us to listen to our neighbours TV all night. Staying in Europe for 5 weeks in accomodation on the cheaper end of the scale was really great- apart from Hotel Felice.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel close to termini”
Reviews.Author: YV_Biker
Reviews.Content: Very close to Termini this hotel offers a budget option in a quaint, working class neighborhood with a lot of students and artists. Nearby restaurant Armando's offers great pasta and excellent rosso della casa. I agree that Marco at the desk was a memorable part of our trip, his advice and anecdotes represent the best of Italy. He also recommended us to a nearby seafood restaurant (can't find it online) with very reasonably priced Roman-style seafood. The rooms are strictly utilitarian and offer minimal accommodations. Bathrooms are communal but are clean. Our double room had a bidet and sink. IF you are looking for an inexpensive stay with easily accessible transportation to most points in Rome, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “My home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gary D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms and good location there are the plus! Marco at the front desk as super he speaks a good english! The location in san lorenzo quarter was good, pub, pizzeria and supermarket close to the hotel. Very easy for the public transportation with the bus 71. We want to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ilona u Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felice is an excellent hotel for the budget traveller if you want to stay close to the Termini station. Good rooms size, clean bath and friendly staff, expecially Marco! Close to the Metro and bus stop, there are also hop on -hop off tourist buses that depart from Termini station. Next time I wiil stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel we found the front door broken! The breakfast was really poor and provided in a nearby bar, consisting of a small croissant and a cup of coffee. There was no alivator and we had to carry our bags on the stairs....To reach our room we had to pass through a balcony! The bathroom of the room was old, nothing to do with what is shown at the pictures online! It didn t gine you thw impression that it was totally clean and the cleaning ladies every day took more time changing places in our shoes, clothes and pitjamas rather than cleaning the room itself! Last but not least, during the first night there, the heat was off and we freezed until next morning! Only after we insisted that it was really cold and we were not overreacting, they gave it a check and found out that they indeed had closed our central heating! All this would not be dramatic if it was about a hostel that we payed 20euros/a day for. But it is about a hotel that should do more in the price it s giving us and at least be truthfull in the description it is giving online!! Would I recommend it? Absolutely not!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felice”
Reviews.Author: Claudia C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with excellent attendence. A note for visitors: ask for a safe way to the main railway station "termini" from where underground conection to all locations in Roma are possible as well as bus or train conections to airports

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: thomascox45
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel through expedia in November and it was a delightful experience. It is a great little place for the budget traveller. The Hotel Felice was cheap, lovely located and the staff were very helpfull. Our triple room and the bath were very clean and comfortable. Close to the bus stop 71 and Termini station area. When we return to Rome we will booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options at this price tag”
Reviews.Author: Emily vdb v
Reviews.Content: The room is old and super basic - other than toilet paper, towels and 2 sachet of shampoo, there's nothing else and no air-conitioning. Rooms on the inside have windows that open into a shared courtyard that is very noisy at night. The rooms themselves have paper thin walls - every sound your neighbor makes including toilet flashing can be heard loud and clear. There are also some rooms without shower/ WC...we've bumped into people wrapped in towels along the corridor. The saving grace is that it's clean and the staff though English challenged are friendly and willing to help. A surprise is that we were told they only accept cash when we arrive - though the website clearly stated that we can pay by cards. The neighborhood is not one of the best and the walk to the termini is about 10 - 15 minutes. I know Rome hotels are expensive, but at this price tag, there are better choices closer to the termini. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room - like a prison cell (see the photo)”
Reviews.Author: feradz
Reviews.Content: Our room looked like a "luxury" prison cell - a big bathroom with a double bed (see the photo). The location of the hotel is bad too. It is not close to the city center. The hotel is 20 min walking distance to Termini train station from where you can use bus/metro to go to the city center. But don't rely on the public transport in Rome it is one of the worst in Europe. In addition, at night this area is full of homeless people and looks quite intimidating. I definitely recommend to not book this hotel - too overpriced for the quality what you get. The cleaning service did not change our towels and bed sheets. The breakfast is only a cafe and a croissant - the hotel does not have a restaurant and sends the guests to the cafe which is in front. The last day the guy from the reception called us at 10:00 and in quite rude way asked us to leave - "Sir you have 10 minutes to check-out." There is a bar at the same building and it is very noisy to sleep. There is no air conditioner. The first day when we arrived and saw this terrible room I asked to cancel the reservation. They said that it is not possible and that still they will charge me for the full 4-nights reservation. I asked to upgrade to a better room in the same hotel - they said that I need to make a new reservation and still pay the full price for the prison cell.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: mirckbettunyork
Reviews.Content: We stay in this good hotel for 5 nights in our italy's holiday. The Felice was good, with friendly staff and amazing hospitality. This was our first time visiting Rome and the hotel location was perfect, close to the Termini Station, roman restaurant and markets. Marco at the reception give us a map and showed us all the point of interest in Rome, Marco was very important for our Rome's tour. The hotel Felice is a small family run hotel with clean rooms and basic price. We want to stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “We can recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike0gbb
Reviews.Content: Good structure close to the centre, about 15 minutes walk from the train station. The Hotel Felice was fine, a good budget hotel with a good staff. The staff was helpfull and very friendly, especially Marco(front desk). The italian breakfast was very good with an excellent capuccino and croissant. Our family room was big enough for a 2 stars hotel for 130 Eur daily. The hotel was ok for the price and for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient hotel!”
Reviews.Author: georgeMrT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in the excellent hotel, good position in Rome, close to the Termini station, easy walking distance from the major sites and metro. Friendly staff at the reception desk, Marco speaks a good english and for us was a very good thing. Clean double room, first floor in the back. Cleaning room every day. Great price and good sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dejeke
Reviews.Content: The standard was good, this was a good two stars hotel. Close to the centre, close to the main station Termini, close to the public transportation(bus 71 for Trevi fountain). The staff was very friendly and welcoming when we arrive, Marco speeks a good english and he was very important for us for the directions. Our double comfort room was basic but good and clean. Good Cappuccino and croissant in the garden in front of the hotel. If we come back we choose again this structure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GordonBass
Reviews.Content: Good position close to the public transportation and Termini Station. Location name, San lorenzo quarter a good real romam area with good cheap restaurant. The hotel Felice was a good idea, clean, budget and centrally located. Our family room was very comfortable with a big bathroom for 140 Euro daily with breakfast included. Marco was a treasure with the important information for restaurants and historical sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, family staff”
Reviews.Author: gordonbellatrix
Reviews.Content: Book the Hotel Felice was a good idea, close to the Termini station and close to many local restaurants. Plus: clean rooms, free wifi connection in the room, friendly staff, close to supermarkets. Negative: No lift. We recommend this hotel for the public transportation and the historical sights.

Reviews.Title: “Low prices good standards”
Reviews.Author: kirce
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for a week in Rome with my family, we take a family room for 130 Eur daily, a big room in the back of the hotel, 1 double bed and 2 twin beds. About 15 min. walk from the Termini train station; we found it easier to walk to the metro. The room was cleaned every day, that was nice. The hotel Felice is in an interesting area(san lorenzo), where you can fill life of Rome. We park our car in the private garage of the hotel for 15 Eur daily. Staff of hotel were very friendly. All in All we had wery good stay in the hotel Felice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean place”
Reviews.Author: marcjello
Reviews.Content: For us the Hotel Felice was the best two stars hotel that we visited in our holiday in Italy. Basic hotel for budget traveller, but very very clean rooms and bathrooms. If you want an hotel only for sleep the Hotel Felice is an excellent hotel! Marco at the front desk was a fantastic person and helping us to find the Colosseum and the borghese gallery. Our room was decent and an ok size for three people. The location is also ok, close to the Termini station, easy walking in about 7 minutes. The 71 bus was an excellent public transportation for reaching the Trevi Fountain. Thank you so much, see you next year, Marcello Jimenez.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel without problem in Rome centre”
Reviews.Author: eckartm
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel in the centre of Rome, nice helpfull reception staff. The air conditioning in the common spaces was very satisfied. Hotel location in Rome was very good, abot 15 minutes walking from Termini station, close to the town centre. No lift available in the hall. Rooms basic but clean, water pressure very very good. For a good restaurant close to the hotel choose Armando. Hotel well situated with easy access to all forms of transport. Thank yuo for the nice holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality price hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbrogger
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felice was an excellent 2 stars hotel close the central train station, about 3 blocks. This is a family business hotel, a little clean hotel in the centre of Rome. Our room was not big but clean, comfort very good. Price range from 50 to 100 eur for 1 triple standard room. Marco at the reception was very helpfull and speaks with us about the history of Rome and the historical sights. Good restaurants close to the Hotel, also a great wine bar accross the street in the garden. We recommend the Hotel Felice, we want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff and we will never be back”
Reviews.Author: Alison R
Reviews.Content: If you do end up staying at this hotel there is a nice seafood place next door (it doesnt look like much but it has fantastic food).

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jamy s
Reviews.Content: Stay with my family in August 2011 in this family hotel, the staff were very good and friendly. 15 minutes of walking to the Roma Termini under the sun! Me and my family (my wife and two children, age 4 and 15) found an excellent relationship between price/quality, price for 1 Quadruple room was 80 Euro! Plus: clean, friendly, location, but no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient central location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: carlosgb89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for Rome prices, great staff, Marco is a super receptionist. Good location for buses and rail travel, good tourist information from the staff, free map and internet. Small room but very clean. Good breakfast in the garden, excellent croissant. I visited Rome with 3 friends for a city break and we felt quite safe in the San Lorenzo surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Not the nicest hotel you can find”
Reviews.Author: sarajahe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online merely because of the price; 60€/night. We were staying in Rome only for a few hours to get some sleep before heading to Naples. I could never suggest this hotel to anyone. The clerk at night was rude, did not speak ANY english what so ever and all in all was an unpleasant figure. This hotel is not near the railway station, the taxi costs a lot and they have no A/C. Insted we got a plastic fan to use. The street noises(there is a bar just outside)can be heard to the room quite nicely. There was no bathroom in the room, only on the corridor. Which by the way was not mentioned when i booked the room at www.easytobook.com. I find it very amusing that a person that works at a hotel reception(i'll grant it to him though, he was an old man)does not understand a word of english. I have no idea who this "Marco" is of whom people are talking here but I'm afraid we did not meet him. You will find a MUCH better hotel from the centre of Rome on the same price. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the attraction, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: barcinolory
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days with my wife at Felice and it was great. Walking distance from every main attractions and very close to Roma Termini station. Nice front desk staff, especially Marco; Good location for proximity of many roman restaurant. The rooms were small but very clean. Good family business hotel for budget traveller. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain! Quiet and clean.”
Reviews.Author: nargiesp
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly, helpful staff. Nice cafes and shops all around. Rooms small but clean, big bath inside the room. The male staff were great though, Marco was great. It was a quite quiet place so I could relax. Easy to find and to get every where, bus 71 easy use from the hotel. When we return to Rome I will choose this hotel again. I HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: “excellent two stars hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: marysuperstar
Reviews.Content: It was close to the Termini central train station, about 10 minutes walk, great location with restaurant, pizzeria and supermarket. Double room pretty clen and good size, bathroom very clean. Welcoming staff, Marco was great, very friendly person. Good location and nice staff: an excellent place. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would be perfect if it not for the noise from the street at night.”
Reviews.Author: Camouflage_Aquila
Reviews.Content: It is a short walk from Roma Termini Station (approx. less than 10 mins), though the streets you will walk to & from the hotel to the station will cause you to pass a number of homeless people since they are sort of back streets. However, it is in a convenient location when you'd like to go sight-seeing & have to go on the Hop On- Hop Off bus or Metro. The hotel has no lifts (you'll have to climb stairs to the rooms) and does not have its own cafe/restaurant (the free breakfast is a tie-in with a small bar across the street where you can choose coffee/tea/milk and plain/cream/choco croissant). The room we stayed in was a Triple Room on the 2nd floor right at the corner of the building. It was a basic room: 2 single beds joined together & a single bed, hot & cold shower, NO AIRCON. The room was well-kept & clean, though they do not change your sheets. The downside was that due to no aircon, we had to sleep with the windows open...and at night, it becomes noisy until the early hours of the morning due to the number of small restaurants / hang out places close by. This caused a few sleepless nights. One plus factor is the very good pizza restaurant a few metres from the hotel front...you won't miss it as it has a lot of locals eating there every night. A must if you are staying in Hotel Felice or within the vicinity of Via Tiburtina!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: LisanCharlie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felice is on the east side of the train station, a little bit of a walk to the main attractions. But it's near lots of public transportation (although we walked everywhere), and it's far enough away that there are fantastic restaurants where locals, not tourists, are eating. The staff is friendly (not all English-speaking), and there's a great garden patio where we enjoyed a bottle of wine every afternoon. Breakfast is across the street at a cafe in a small park, fantastic croissants and cappuccino. The room was on the small side, but the bathroom was enormous and very nice. No air conditioning, so it was a little loud at night with the windows open, especially on Friday when there were more than a few shouting matches outside. That was really the only downside. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family business hotel”
Reviews.Author: barcelona78robin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend at the end of May 2011 and we were very satisfied. The hotel is within easy distance of all of Rome but the nearest walking distance attractions to the hotel were the Repubblica Square, Nazionale street and the Colosseum. Nice clean room and very clean bathroom. The location was good, a lot of guys and girls in the area, excellent nightlife zone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: lisafarrell80
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felice was in a great location close to the public transportation. The rooms were of a decent size for what you need in a city break and was very peaceful. Marco in the afternoon also spoke very good english. I would reconment the hotel Felice as it is in walking distance of most historical sites and Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location, quite hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorenaNY
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Hotel Felice in Rome. We stay 8 nights and we were satisfied. First- thank you Marco, you are a gentleman, but all the staff was very good, They were absolutely wonderful. This hotel was ideal for visiting all the most important site in Rome, close to Nazionale street and Termini Station. The Termini metro is about 7 minutes walking also you can find two supermarket in the area. we recommend this hotel for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the centre”
Reviews.Author: parisriver85
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after looking at ratings for hotels on booking.com and we were not disappointed! Me and my wife, stayed in the hotel for 5 nights, its close to the centre and Termini train station, bus 71 in front of the hotel was very good for the Trevi fountain. Also a good location for restaurant and pizzeria. Clean small hotel with friendly staff. Overall, great hotel, staff treats you like family, and an outstanding value.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel close to the university”
Reviews.Author: gennycourt
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied about my stay in this hotel. Little rooms but very clean, close to the historical sights and very close to the La Sapienza University. Friendly staff especially Marco in the afternoon. My private bath was clean. Breakfast in the morning was served in the garden: good croissant and cappuccino. I recommend this hotel for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “I’m glad I’ve chosen this lovely hotel which is extremely vital when you’re traveling!”
Reviews.Author: Iuliana-Juliana
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 nights at this hotel in March 2010 and was extremely impressed! Hotel Felicia is a family-run hotel, and the family are very welcoming, friendly and exceptionally helpful. My room was large enough, very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was not very big, but adequate. The towels were changing every day! The wireless Internet is free, TV, phone in the room. While staying at the hotel I felt to be in safe. The hotel is located the historical part of the city in 2 minutes from a bus stop and in 10 minutes from the Termini Railway Station.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful and good location for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: assemkin
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family during Christmas time. We liked the location. Everything in the room was "standard", as we had expected. The staff were very kind and helpful. The location is great: train station is in a 5 min walk as well as touristic busses and shops. There is a grocery shop across the street and nice pizza place around the corner. I would choose this hotel for my next visit. :-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent, good value”
Reviews.Author: rauhunt
Reviews.Content: +ve : The staffs were very friendly and helpful . Free wi-fi (some hotels charge 5 euro per hr or even more). Cable TV with around 30 channels to choose. Free luggage storage (we leaved our luggages for more than 24 hrs!). We stayed in double room with shared toilet, both room and toilet were excellent. Close to termini station. What else I can say? Everything superb and value for money. Breakfast included and lovely. 100% recommended -ve : Staffs dont speak english really well (except only 1 guy who speaks fluent english). Anyway body language did help us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly & very helpful”
Reviews.Author: adamsapp
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel. We stayed in the hotel for 6 days it was an excellent value for the money. Marco at the front desk was very welcoming and helpfull for the direction to the historical sights. Only 2 minutes walk from Termini Station, in san lorenzo area; It is a very practical location close to major public transport. Overall a very good price/quality relationship at a very good location near Termini Metro Station. I'd definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: jchaze03
Reviews.Content: Bad service ( no change in towels) , loud, told us did not take credit cards.....concur completely with the last reviewer althought the immediate neighborhood we found ok...good restaurants and pubs....lots of young people.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cataratas
Reviews.Content: Although advertised as being close to Termini Station, Hotel Felice is actually an unpleasant 20 minute walk through an unsightly area.The hotel is located in a very noisy and unattractive neighborhood that could be dicey for women in the evening.The hotel staff speaks virtually no English and several of them are unfriendly as well.Sleep was impossible in our cramped and ugly room due to both the incredible street noise as well as noise from within the hotel.Motorbikes went by all night long, and crowds talked late into the night underneath our window.We were faced with a difficult choice, either shut the windows in the sweltering heat(the hotel air conditioning, if they even had it, had been shut off) or close them and roast(and still hear some street noise) And while the hotel brochure indicates that they accept credit cards, they lied to us and insisted that they only accepted cash.Are you listening Mr. Taxman? The Hotel Felice is no bargain at any price.Avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but very basic place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lorettalenox
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felice is located near the terminal but it is not very convenient to other attractions, because it is on the side of the terminal that is away from everything.. It is very clean, but very simple in its accommodations. The staff is generally helpful. There is a terrace that is quite nice. The most negative thing for us was the noise from the street at night, it was quite intrusive, also our room faced an alley that was pretty messy. We had no issue with the lack of A/C as it was farily cool, but this must be a problem in the summer. The bottom line is you really do get what you pay for, its inexpensive relative to other hotels in Rome and what you get is a clean room and a reasonably helpful staff-that's it

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel- OK to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Krispy831
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and accommodating and the hotel is close to termini but a little bit of a hike to other areas. The terrace on the second floor was nice to sit and have a bottle of wine on. They tried to get us to pay cash our first night by saying our credit card was declined even though we never gave them one. We just ignored their request and paid via credit card when we left. The night clerk doesn’t speak English and it was hard to communicate with him when we needed a fan or a wake-up call.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: 29FLSheila
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay overnight in Rome before an early flight out, instead of an overnight train, so booked a room in the a.m. Received confirmation/voucher almost immediately, but upon arrival that evening was told that the reservation had been cancelled! Apparently it was, for no legitimate reason, some time after the first email, but as we were in transit all day did not receive this info, certainly not by phone even though we'd left our cell #. They, of course, were "kind" enough to recommend another hotel, just a little bit further away. I've heard of this scam (small hotel, overbooks on purpose, then provides alternate suggestion)but was surprised as they'd received decent reviews. Partially chosen for proximity to train station, but the hood was a bit sketchy for walking at night and there seemed to be plenty of decent hotels much closer.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For - No A/C”
Reviews.Author: dmilesut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a reasonable distance from the Termini. It's not a short walk, but it's definitely not a very far walk. The hotel is located in an area without as many tourists which I like. The area really comes alive at night. The hotel is nice, but it's not equipped with a/c and you are only allowed 1 fan per room. If you are staying in a room with the windows facing the interior of the hotel (not along Via Tiburtina), it's manageable with the windows open, but not if you are along Via Triburtina. I'm from Texas so I'm accustomed to being warm, but it's difficult to go to sleep when there are restaurants and bars right below your hotel room ( see for yourself - google street view -http://bit.ly/bxIqg8). The store fronts to the left of the hotel are open at night as you can see from the google street view image). To Hotel Felice's credit, they did move us after not being able to sleep in that room. We were able to move to a room that had the windows facing the interior of the hotel. The other glitch we had was when the hotel staff asked for cash at check out. To their credit, they mentioned in on the first day and not at check out, but if you take a credit card as a deposit, you ought to be able to pay with it. I ended up paying half credit card and half cash. Sorry, I don't like to complain, but I feel the product is a bit misrepresented. Now, onto more pleasant things about the hotel! There is a terrific pizza shop. Really, pizza is pizza to me, but the service and the price were fantastic! It is Pizza Tonde - Il mattarello d'oro (not sure that is the real name) - it's on Via Degli Equi (look at google maps here: http://bit.ly/bt6Zro). Basically, it's has good service, great price, and it's really close to the hotel. You can get 2 large pizzas and 2 drinks for 11 Euros. It took 3 healthy male appettites to eat all of the pizza. There is also a good gelato place across the street from the pizza place as well. Overall, Hotel Felice is probably an OK place to stay, but I really think it's unfair to guests that there are restaurants and bars below their rooms when there only form of air circulation is a small fan and open windows especially when it's warm outside. The place is probably a lot more favorable in the colder months. I would also be very weary of the other reviews on this website that give it 5 stars (they have only given one review - usually an indication that the hotel is the one giving the review.) I hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good price -- but at a cost!”
Reviews.Author: premile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel in July 2010 for 5-nights. Positives: -The hotel was priced well (budget). -The staff was friendly and hospitable. -The hotel had a very pleasant communal balcony. -There were lots of good restaurants for dinner within walking distance. -Free WiFi. Negatives: -No air conditioning, view, or refrigerator. -We had to take a bus (#71) to get to everywhere. -There was visible graffiti on the exterior of the hotel. -The neighborhood was less than desirable; lots of graffiti, it felt ghetto.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE ROOMS TERRIBLE BEDS TERRIBLE VALUE unless youre a masochist”
Reviews.Author: castnerm
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felice is run by crooks, and possibly designed by satan himself. There is no AC, and the windows open up to a busy vespa-filled street. Its a Catch 22 that results in 2 hours of sleep a night, and a very sweaty pillow, unless its winter. The beds are uncomfortable, lumpy and noisy. The kicker is that if you try to leave this hellhole, the proprietors charge you the full duration of the reservation and threaten you if you protest. Honestly, this is the worst place Ive ever stayed. Even if youre ok with roughing it in the above conditions, there are far better places to stay. 30 euro per person can get you a pretty reasonable hostel bed with the EXACT SAME AMENITIES. Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else. Im really not sure how this place has been getting such good reviews as a HOTEL. Im hoping this place goes out of business so no one else has to stay in such a crooked craphole.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant summer stay, could find better for same price”
Reviews.Author: Cata_883
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Felice because of the price, but especially if you are traveling in the summer I highly recommend you look somewhere else. *Location* Although on a map the hotel looks close to the city center, it is not. So arriving to the hotel via train, bus, or taxi is very costly. By taxi it is about 50-60 euros. By train and then bus it's about 15euro per person. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk away from Termini Station which a large bus/train/metro station from where you can go nearly everywhere in Rome. However, that 15 minute walk is quite unpleasant, especially at night. The streets are dirty and graffiti decorates every square foot of wall. While we stayed at the hotel (5 days) a car in front of the hotel was badly broken into. So the area is clearly not very safe. There are no places of interest at a walking distance from the hotel. Taking metro or bus everyday is necessary to see the sights. *Room* The rooms are quite small (like most in Europe) and only some have bathrooms included. We stayed in one that did. The towels are not changed every day, which is a small detail, but after 3 days it was unpleasant to have old towels. The television was not working and the staff was not helpful in fixing it. **There is no air conditioning*** which is probably my greatest complaint. In Rome, most tourists go to the ancient sites and see the many things that make Rome famous, which means walking - a lot. So when you get back exhausted, hot, and tired, the last thing you want is your hotel room to be humid, hot, and cramped. The room was hotter than the outside at times, and the only way to try to cool it down was to open the windows and turn on the tiny table fan that was provided. It was unbearable to sleep and the loud street noise was not helpful. And to top it off, on our last night there, the rusty water pipes leaked and our bathroom flooded and eventually got the entire room wet. The only person working at the desk begrudgingly came to help us and finally made us clean it up ourselves with - a dust pan and broom! *Staff* Needless to stay the staff was not very helpful as illustrated with the whole flooding issue. And there were no moments in which they really seemed to care whether we were comfortable or enjoying our stay. -- Most of the reviews I read for this hotel were very good, so I was looking forward to a good stay. Unfortunately it was not so. The air conditioning is really a problem and I would never want to stay in Rome in the summer without it again. There are other hotels nearby which look much better and are only about 20 euros more expensive. Look into those to save money, because I don't think this hotel is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap place to stay, fairly comfortable, but not close to the station...”
Reviews.Author: Me_n_my_rucksack
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here in June 10. Our initial impression was not good, as the place is at least 15 mins from the Railway Stn on foot, possibly 20 with luggage. Although hardly through life threatening ganglands as some have put its through a fairly scruffy area. The hotel is clean and the room fairly comfortable. That said in 6 days we never had clean sheets ! The day staff had reasonable English and the night staff none. Breakfast is served in a cafe 50ft away, one takes a voucher and get a basic coffee and coissant. For us this place served a purpose - a very cheap place to stay for a week. Its a reasonable place to stay provided you realise it really isnt that close to the Termini and one gets what one pays for.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bhamianinhsv
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget and the type of person who packs light and can sleep anywhere, this hotel would be great for you. If, however, like my husband and me, you have lots of heavy bags and need a soft bed and quiet place to sleep, you might want to look elsewhere. The staff were fairly friendly, although not overly so. I did appreciate their attempts to speak English, as my Italian is fairly limited. The room was pretty small, and we chose the cheapest kind (with a shared bathroom). The bathrooms were pretty clean, but sometimes it was hard to get extra towels. There's a nice little terrace, but we didn't spend enough time at the hotel for it to be a big plus. There was free WiFi which worked well enough, although it cut out sometimes when I would try to upload or email pictures. The beds were hard, and the street was noisy. It's also a good 15 minute walk from the train station, which doesn't seem like a lot until you're exhausted and dragging lots of luggage. Since we needed a quieter, more comfortable and convenient place to sleep, we chose a different hotel for our last night in Rome. But this place was decent for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: portermargaret7
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe so I had no great expectations when it came to accomodations. I stayed here with a friend for 5 nights. The room was OK, had 2 beds as confirmed. No lift so one has to carry luggage up many steps and the beds are like rock hard. Staff not very accomodating. Asked for three days for them to reserve a ticket for a Galleria I really wanted to see. After asking and getting nowhere I stayed at the Hotel to make sure they called and of course the museum was now booked for a week! On one morning around 7:00 am I could not get out of the Hotel for my morning walk. The metal gate was locked and closed on the front door. Besides being a fire hazard. the staff member was in the back room in the shower!! The night before we left we were given a note saying we needed to pay cash at checkout. We were not told this before and had planned on putting it on our Credit card. We had already reserved one more night for our last night which was confirmed via email by the owners son. I had a copy and when we checked out they confirmed that we would have the same room. When I came back 12 days later the room we were given had 1 bed, smelled of the incinerator and after complaining before I touched anything they said that was the only room they had. Our room was reserved for this night over 30 days prior. What really upset my friend and I is that the owners son got on the phone with her daughter who speaks and lives in Italy and blatantly LIED 3 times. The fact that they did not admit their error and had to lie made us very uncomfortable and unhappy. We will not ever stay or recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Family Rome's party”
Reviews.Author: tonypittequila
Reviews.Content: We stay 10 nights at the Felice Hotel. Our family Rome's party was extraordinary. The Hotel was good for location price and staff. The room was clean, spacious, and nice. Breakfast wasn't excellent but typically roman. The Hotel Felice was convenient for the public transportation into the city centre and the local area was great for the trattoria. We enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “first time party in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rometripgonzo
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with with comfortable room. Abot 500 meters from the station, 10 minutes of walking make it more suitable for traveller. This was the first time we stayed at Hotel Felice. Me and my family (6 peoples found an excellent relationship between price/quality/comfort. We were absolutely surprised by the quality of the Quintuple room, overall great value stay with a fantastic room and and sparkling bathroom! No lift.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Hopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights 13th, 14th and 15th June and have never been to such an aweful place. Cockroaches in the bathroom and rude staff sum up this place. Please don't fall for the pictures and descriptions on the hotel's website or over-generous reviews it has received. Avoid at all cost - there are plenty of better hotels in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: travels66
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my stay at the Hotel Felice, but unfortunately had to cancel my reservation ten days later. Luckily I was within the time allotted to cancel without penalty. I followed the instructions provided and immediately received an email confirming my cancelation. However, I found the email I received a couple hours later asking me never to book with them again rude and unprofessional. This was my first time booking with them so it’s not as if I had a history of canceling that might warrant this 2nd email. It makes me wonder what sort of treatment I would have received if I had stayed with them. When I reschedule my trip to Rome I will definitely not be staying at the Hotel Felice.

Reviews.Title: “Did not measure up to other hotels in its class”
Reviews.Author: Rover4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three 2-star hotels in Venice, Florence, and Rome. This one fell way short. Although its web site boasts of its convenient location, it is a long walk from the train station and in a seedy, scary neighborhood. Instead of offering breakfast, they gave us a voucher to go to a nearby bar for just a coffee and a pastry. There is no air conditioning, and the smells from the alley below made it impossible to have the window open. On the night before we checked out, they gave us a printed page saying there was a problem with their credit card processing equipment and that we needed to pay the entire sum in cash, making it necessary for a last-minute trip to the only nearby ATM, where panhandlers were hanging out. On the positive side, the hosts were charming and the room clean and comfortable, but the overall experience was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine place, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: tylerjonh765
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felice is in a safe neighbourhood close to the Termini Station. The hotel is simple but convenient and clean. We stayed with 4 persons in 1 room and had a good time. The owners were very friendly and helpful. For travel on a budget, it's a great find. Electrical adapter available at the reception. There are restaurants and an internet and laundry station right around the corner. The breakfast is good with a great "capuccino coffee". The staff are really friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean. I woul stay here again because of the overall value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sherylbpayne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Felice hotel for the 1st time last week for 7 days. The hotel is about a 5 min walk from Termini about 2 blocks from the station. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The price was very decent. We walked easily to the Termini Station, Nazionale street and Repubblica square. Free internet wireless access in the terrace. Home in Rome. we'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Why Not Just Sleep On The Street? It's Free And Nicer Than This Place.”
Reviews.Author: gruagach7
Reviews.Content: Never, ever stay at this “hotel” unless you have no standards whatsoever. A stay at this “hotel” is like that of a stray dog winding up in a cage at the local pound. There are so many horrible aspects to this hotel. I’ll start at the beginning. We copied directions from the hotel’s website to walk from Roma Termini. The directions could not have been more incorrect. It took us about 45 minutes to find the place. And if you are walking be prepared: this hotel is not in a nice neighborhood - especially at night - and it‘s a good 10-15 minute trek through the slums from Termini. We were actually afraid to walk from Roma Termini to the hotel at night. We had a hard time finding the hotel at first because the entire building -- and street block -- is covered in graffiti. Sweaty and tired, we were buzzed into the hotel (another sign of the type of neighborhood). The hotel staff speak absolutely no English whatsoever, which is completely fine as we shouldn’t expect them to, but just know that there is no tolerance or acceptance of foreigners. My two travel companions and myself meandered our way through the check-in process. The problem is that the man at the reception counter treated us horribly and kept screaming at us in Italian. Listen, buddy, if we didn’t understand you the first time we’re not going to understand you the sixth time. Then he demands we give him our passports to “hold” them until we check out. It was bad enough we couldn’t grasp what he was saying, but then him yelling at us to give our passports was bizarre. We reluctantly handed them over. The man at the counter was so nasty and rude I totally expected him to sell our passports on the black market leaving us lost in Rome with no identification. We all had bags with us and were staying on the second floor. Hotel Felice has no elevator -- and this place has a lot of stairs that twist and turn. The trip up to the second floor was almost as bad as the journey from Termini. When we were leaving to check out, we just threw our bags down the stairs and hoped for the best. Needless to mention, nobody from the hotel staff offered to help us either time. The room: all things considered it was a normal cheap hotel room: beds, a small desk and a bathroom. We had a triple room with a private bath. The problem was the temperature. It was a hot August day so we weren’t expecting the room to be cool, but the temperature in the room was easily 10-15 degrees more than the temperature outside. Plus, this place has no air conditioning and virtually no circulation. The three of us were looking for a room to chill out and relax in and instead we had to go outside in the sweltering heat to escape the heat in our room. Like Hotel Felice, it was a lose-lose situation. We spent the day touring Rome and, begrudgingly, returned to Hotel Felice at night. There was another man at the front desk who yelled at us for taking our key with us. Apparently, you are supposed to check in the key whenever you leave. Fine. Whatever. Then he throws our passports back to us (couldn’t get a good price on the market I guess…) and mumbles something in Italian. Our room was just as hot at night as it was during the day. We all took turns getting up during the night and taking ice cold showers to cool our body temperatures. Another thing that kept us up during the night was the constant pounding and slamming outside in the hallway. The doors are paper thin and do not block any noise -- at all. Also, it was *always* noisy outside. Motorcycles revved their engines all night long and there seems to be one constant party outside the hotel room . Given the neighborhood and surrounding environment, the party was probably a large drug transaction that lasted for hours. Unless you are a very, very heavy sleeper, you will not get any rest at this place. We woke up early to leave this horrible place (it’s not like we slept anyway) and a foul odor seemed to have seeped in throughout the night. It was absolutely rancid. We couldn’t leave fast enough. Check-out was another ordeal. Suffice to say we paid them whatever they wanted just so we could leave as soon as possible. Thankfully, we had only booked a room for one night. Any longer and we would have just left and gone to another hotel where the rooms weren’t 115 degrees, didn’t smell like rotted egg and dirty socks and didn’t have to worry about being offered heroine outside the front door. To sum up: if you choose to say here best wishes to me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felice will NOT make you happy!It should be renamed~Hotel Infelice”
Reviews.Author: Luv2CtheC
Reviews.Content: The rooms very so small and there was no air conditioning. You had to leave the windows open and it was located on the corner of two streets and it was very noisy. My hairdryer blew out the fuse and the power went out in the last couple of rooms. The people working at the front desk were incredibly rude. The washroom was disgusting and boyfriend decided he wouldn't enter that shower so thank goodness we were only staying the night. It smelt like an old age home filled with medications. The smell in the hallway made me nauseous. There was no elevator and many stairs to get to the second floor so be prepared to carry your luggage upstairs. There is no hotel parking. There are so many nice little hotels in Rome... don't stay in this one!

Reviews.Title: “Next time, I'll look for an other”
Reviews.Author: ECBorges
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location (next the Roma Termini), it's easy to find when you arrive at Roma. It isn't next to the monuments, but is next to the bus and metro station. The rooms are clean and the badrooms are cleaned everyday. They don't have a breakfast, so we had to take a ticket everyday to eat in a cafeteria in front of the hotel. It was included, but we could have just a croissant and a capuccino. Two situations have made us upset: first, when we arrrive the hotel they said that we could not use the credit card, because the card machine was not in use, and we had to be prepared to pay by cash. It was not agreed before, but we didn't discussed. Reading the reviews on this web site I saw the same complaint, so we where not the first . The second situation was when we asked a new towel, becouse one of our has become dirty. They didn't give us, and said that everyday they would change the towels, what didin't happened. Dispite of the good things, next time I will look for an other.

Reviews.Title: “Take This One Off the NYTimes Recommended List”
Reviews.Author: AusCali
Reviews.Content: The room was fine for the rate we paid. Cleanliness not a problem. Location was good. But we encountered some unfair or even dishonest practices. They handed us a photocopied form letter on the first morning of our stay, stating that their credit card swiping machine didn't work and, somehow therefore we needed to pay in cash. That would have been 840 euros in cash and they wanted it before the end of our hotel stay. After causing us consternation and confusion because of their hiding behind their Italian, we let them know we refuse. We wanted to request a cab through them, but they wanted 65 euros to be paid to them when we knew a cab ride to Fiumicino Airport is 40 euros flat. When we asked about why the difference in price, the guy became defensive and made up a lousy excuse--that our departure was on new year's day. They pretend they don't know or understand enough English as an alibi. All the rooms were upstairs, but there was no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Charming neighborhood, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycboo
Reviews.Content: Not a lot of character, but spotless hotel in a very fun neighborhood. Rooms were cozy, clean and simple. They ran out of ensuite bathrooms, so we had a shared shower/toilet (but had a sink in the room). Turned out to be fine. It's not as close to Termini Station as they claim (at least 10 minute walk), but good bus lines pass by frequently. I loved the neighborhood and found some outstanding restaurants down the street (including Said's - upscale chocolate/dinner place, and other trattorias).

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: i_love_fabregas
Reviews.Content: me and bf stayed there in march to watch arsenal in the champions league and made a mini holiday out of it. Hotel was in a great location, took us a gd day 2 work out where we were, but once we got the hang of the buses and metro it was brilliant! i wouldnt call it a bed and breakfast, cos the breakfast is a small crossant and coffee or tea from the cafe across the road. but the staff were very friendly!! always keen to help us out. the rooms are ok, can be very noisy and the bathroom were shared, but they were always cleaned. would definetly recommend a friend to stay here, we got it at a very gd price too!!

Reviews.Title: “Hot, noisey, and room smelled!”
Reviews.Author: flyboy51
Reviews.Content: Don't stay there during the summer(July). Room was very hot!! No air conditioning. Restaurant behind room 21 was very noisey. Bidet smelled, had to close the bathroom while I was in the room. Picture of room, not like the real thing. Only one English news station on TV. Everything else is in Italian. Other than that, Staff was really nice, except for one older gentlemen that works the night, early morning shift. Don't speak and understand English. No elevator, so don't bring to much stuff!! Only thing really great is free WiFi, and either American coffee or Italian coffee, and a pastry for breakfast, between, 8-10am.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, at good price”
Reviews.Author: rosmary89
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in Rome with my cousins during our holiday among Europe and we had a wonderful stay in this hotel, that exceeded our expectations. We picked hotel Felice based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. The location was excellent, very close to the train/bus/metro station, and even if I don't think it is in the best part of town, I didn't feel unsafe and the convenience was very welcome. You will not find a better hotel for the money!!! Clean, comfortable, quiet and safe, overall the hotel was very good with respect to amenities like clean bathrooms, beds etc. The staff were friendly, nice and young and they answered our questions and gave us directions. We would definitly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felice: a very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: deborahmack
Reviews.Content: I spent three days with my partner in Rome. The main reason was to attend the graduation of a friend of mine at the University of Rome La Sapienza but obviously, we took the chance to visit the city. Therefore the choice of this hotel was perfect: it is very close to the campus and walking distance to subway, bus and tram stops. The area around the hotel is also plenty of pubs and restaurants. The hotel is especially indicated for who looks for a very good place to stay at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A Hostel not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lingner
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews on Trip Advisor (as I always do for all the hotels I stay in) I didn't have high expectations and was kept a very open mind and was trying to very realistic given the price I paid (135 Euros for 2 nights in a double room with shared bathroom). I definitely don't expect to go to another country and have everyone speak English so I didn't mind the communication barrier. However, I must admit for the Rome hospitality industry the staff definitely didn't speak a lot of English. Rooms: I booked the double room with shared bathroom. I thought the bathroom would be shared amongst 2-4 rooms. Upon arrival my boyfriend and I discovered it is 2 washrooms (located on one end of the hallway) amongst the whole floor. There were approximately 10 rooms on the floor and unfortunately we were in a room at the opposite end of where the washrooms were. My impression is this was definitely more like a hostel rather than a hotel (and I have stayed in both before). Location: I read the reviews that the walk to Termini station was far however I thought that was subjective based on how fast an individual walks. Now that I've experienced it I will confirm the walk is about 10 minutes (depending on the route you take) one is on Via Marsala (the longer route but you will get to walk on sidewalks and not through a tunnel) the other is Via Giolotti (through a tunnel and past some tracks). I would definitely say this hotel is more like a hostel. There actually seemed to be quite a few backpackers that stayed there. I wouldn't recommend staying more than 2 nights at this "hotel". Hostel Felice served it's purpose for a place to lay our heads but next time I'm going to opt to pay extra for a private bathroom or just book a hostel if I'm on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: tundra_girlchicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is grossly misrepresented by its website. While there IS a nice outdoor balcony with free wifi, that is about the only redeeming feature. I stayed there for one night in July 2008 and the heat was absolutely unbearable (there is no air conditioning). I requested a fan and was never brought one. My room stank like a sewer (there was a bidet actually IN the shower). I opened the window to get some air and was kept up the entire night by a group of people who congregated directly under the window. I was supposed to stay for 3 nights but left after one. Despite what the Felice website says about a one night penalty for a late cancellation, they charged me for the entire 3 nights. Terrible service. I also felt like the walk from Termini was pretty desolate and as a woman travelling alone, I did not feel safe (I am an experienced traveller, am often on my own, and know the good areas from the bad). You can get a much better deal for the same price elsewhere in Rome. The Felice is a complete ripoff. There are other hotels in Rome that are the same price and offer much much more (air conditioning, closer to Termini etc.). For what they offer, the Felice should be charging at least 30-40% less. Oh, and the front of the hotel was covered in graffiti when I got there. nice. I should have never gone in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashyberries10
Reviews.Content: Visited Felice Hotel last march with my boyfriend. Simple and charming hotel, clean and cosy room. Had no problems at all, and was pleased with our choice! Only drawbacks that is is a bit out of town and takes a while to get to the subway, maybe a 15-20 min walk. There is a few nice restaurants close by. I would recommened if you dont want to spend a fortune when in rome! and dont mind walking to the subway, which is a little far, especially if youre lazy like me!

Reviews.Title: “Good ratio quality/price”
Reviews.Author: perla_059
Reviews.Content: I would like to share with who could be interested, my personal opinion about Hotel Felice which surprised me for the very good ratio quality/price. I planned to be in Rome during the second week of January (four days in total) to attend the graduation of a friend of mine at La Sapienza University; this was the main reason of my choice towards Hotel Felice (that is very closed to the University). Honestly, the hotel is not the best I’ve ever been in my life, but what surprised me was the general environment of the structure: my room were very clean, the reception desk (but at the end all the staff) was very kind to point out the best way to have a look of the city and advised me on the shortest way to reach my destinations. Outside, as I’ve mentioned before, the hotel is placed very closed to Uniservity and obviously into an area frequented by students; so I found a lot of pubs, wine bars and restaurants (there’s a good choice of places to spend the spare time). This is the reason why I would recommend this hotel to a range of people from 20 to 50 years old (there’s some noise from outside during week-end!!). I’ve not used them but I saw that there’s wi-fi connectivity (toll-free service) and also the hotel can arrange some touristic tour into the city. I hope that my opinion could be helpful for you Have fun!!! Perla059

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Felice
HotelInfo.Address: Via Tiburtina 30, 00185 Rome, Italy
